Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery cup; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of two feet, to right above thin reserved band (left big toe with toe-nail; between the feet, possibly drapery; at right, part of undetermined motif; black relief line throughout.
Curator's comments: The difficult sequence of letters in the inscription may suggest that it is one of the forgeries discussed in Corbett and Woodhead 1955; but the brevity of the text is unlike any of theirs, even if the hand is similar.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E812.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0699) (Phase 1)
